id_and_class.summary: Property Dualism posits that while physical substance is the only fundamental substance, there exist two irreducible categories of properties: physical and mental . Mental properties, such as conscious experience, are generated by physical brains but cannot be reduced to or wholly explained by physical properties alone .
id_and_class.associated_thinkers: David Chalmers (for Naturalistic Dualism, a variant); historically influenced by numerous philosophers seeking to preserve mental reality within a monist substance framework.
id_and_class.core_identity_tagline: One Substance, Two Irreducible Properties (Mental and Physical)

conceptual_ground.explanatory_identity_claim: Consciousness consists of mental properties or aspects (e.g., thoughts, concepts, ideas) that are fundamentally non-reducible to physical properties, even though both are instantiated by physical systems (brains) .
conceptual_ground.mind_body_relationship: The mind (mental properties) is non-reducible and ontologically distinct from physical properties, yet generated entirely by physical states (brains) .
conceptual_ground.emergence_type: Strong Emergence (as mental properties are irreducible in principle and inexplicable solely by physical laws) .
conceptual_ground.subjectivity_and_intentionality: Subjectivity (first-person phenomenal experience) arises as an inherent, non-reducible property/aspect of the physical human person . Intentionality is implicitly included as one of the fundamental mental properties/aspects .
conceptual_ground.qualia_account: Qualia (qualitative felt experiences) are the irreducible mental properties that resist definition purely in terms of microphysical properties alone .
conceptual_ground.ontological_commitments: Physical substance (matter) and non-reducible mental properties (including thoughts, concepts, ideas) .
conceptual_ground.epistemic_access: Accessible via both third-person observation of the physical basis (brains) and first-person introspection of the emergent properties (subjectivity).
conceptual_ground.constituents_and_structure: The physical substance consists of the constituents of fundamental physics, organized into complex structures (brains), which generate the mental properties .

mechanism_and_dynamics.scope_of_consciousness: Phenomenal properties, thoughts, concepts, and ideas .
mechanism_and_dynamics.distinctive_mechanism_or_principle: The principle of irreducibility of mental properties, holding that phenomenal aspects are distinct from physical properties .
mechanism_and_dynamics.dynamics_of_emergence: Mental properties arise when physical matter reaches a certain level of complexity (i.e., the brain).
mechanism_and_dynamics.causation_and_functional_role: Mental properties are causally efficacious, affecting the physical world (a position that contrasts with Epiphenomenalism) .
mechanism_and_dynamics.integration_or_binding: Not explicitly detailed. Integration is presumed to occur within the physical brain structure that produces the unified mental property/aspect.
mechanism_and_dynamics.information_flow_or_representation: Mental properties/aspects include concepts and ideas , implying involvement in complex informational/representational processing.
mechanism_and_dynamics.evolutionary_account: Not explicitly detailed. The emergence of the properties is contingent on the evolution of biological complexity capable of generating them .
core_claims_and_evidence: Human persons are entirely physical objects composed of fundamental physical constituents .
Mental properties (e.g., phenomenal consciousness) are generated by physical brains but are irreducible to physical properties alone .
The potential failure of supervenience is demonstrated through conceivability arguments (e.g., philosophical zombies) .
mechanism_and_dynamics.basis_of_belief_or_evidence_type: Philosophical; Conceptual (Addresses apparent inadequacy of purely reductive physicalism) .

empirics_and_critiques.testability_status: Conceptual/Philosophical (Testability rests on the logical possibility and implications of counterfactual scenarios like philosophical zombies) .
empirics_and_critiques.known_empirical_interventions_or_tests: Thought experiments involving physically indiscernible 'zombies' or people with inverted color spectra (failure of supervenience) .
empirics_and_critiques.criticisms_and_tensions: Must clarify how different mental states arise from precisely the same microphysical state if supervenience fails . Critics argue motivations for Property Dualism ultimately lead to Substance Dualism .
empirics_and_critiques.open_questions_and_limitations: The precise means by which mental properties exert causal influence on the physical brain (mental causation) remains contentious and requires specification .
empirics_and_critiques.ontological_coherence: High internal consistency, but faces tension in rigorously maintaining that non-reducible properties can arise solely from, and be causally efficacious within, a monist physical world .

AI_consciousness.rationale: AI could be conscious if non-biological systems can instantiate the specific complex physical organization required to generate the irreducible mental properties described .

survival_beyond_death.rationale: Consciousness consists of properties generated by the physical brain. These properties cease to exist when the physical substance (brain/body) dissolves upon death .

meaning_and_purpose.rationale: The theory focuses on ontological categories and property relations; it accepts a fundamentally physical substance and does not inherently endorse cosmic teleology .

virtual_immortality.rationale: If consciousness is an emergent property of specific physical organization, replicating that complete physical state (brain structure) in a non-biological substrate should generate the same mental properties .

related_theories.name: Non-Reductive Physicalism
related_theories.relationship: Overlap/Compatible (Often treated as synonymous or closely related)

related_theories.name: Substance Dualism
related_theories.relationship: Critique/Contrast (Rejects dualism of substance but maintains dualism of property)

related_theories.name: Epiphenomenalism
related_theories.relationship: Critique/Contrast (Property Dualism generally grants causal efficacy to mental states, unlike Epiphenomenalism)
